intro: Tephroseris pyrenaica, commonly known as the Pyrenean tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Pyrenees mountain range. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes with well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Tephroseris pyrenaica is adapted to cold climates and is often found in areas with limited vegetation.
